title: Quick and pretty frequency tables with ivo_table
text: R great packages creating nice-looking tables. Packages like gt flextable allow user create wide range tables, lots flexibility presented formatted. downside Swiss army knife-style packages simple tasks, like creating frequency table, require lot typing. Enter ivo.table, package creating great-looking frequency tables contingency tables without hassle. package offers two functions creating tables: ivo_table, uses flextable framework, ivo_table_gt uses gt framework. vignette contains examples using former.

title: Quick and pretty frequency tables with ivo_table
text: Let’s look examples using penguins data palmerpenguins package. Say want create contingency table showing counts categorical variables species, sex, island. can use ftable along dplyr’s select: informative, formatting isn’t great, ’s something can easily export report presentation. ivo.table uses syntax, ivo_table instead ftable:  species sex island Biscoe Dream Torgersen Adelie female 22 27 24 male 22 28 23 (Missing) 0 1 5 Chinstrap female 0 34 0 male 0 34 0 (Missing) 0 0 0 Gentoo female 58 0 0 male 61 0 0 (Missing) 5 0 0 resulting table can easily exported Word document: can add row column sums:  species  sex island Biscoe Dream Torgersen Total Adelie female 22 27 24 73 male 22 28 23 73 (Missing) 0 1 5 6 Chinstrap female 0 34 0 34 male 0 34 0 34 (Missing) 0 0 0 0 Gentoo female 58 0 0 58 male 61 0 0 61 (Missing) 5 0 0 5 Total  168 124 52 344 show percentages instead counts, e.g. computed column:  species sex island Biscoe Dream Torgersen Adelie female 13,1 % 21,8 % 46,2 % male 13,1 % 22,6 % 44,2 % (Missing) 0,0 % 0,8 % 9,6 % Chinstrap female 0,0 % 27,4 % 0,0 % male 0,0 % 27,4 % 0,0 % (Missing) 0,0 % 0,0 % 0,0 % Gentoo female 34,5 % 0,0 % 0,0 % male 36,3 % 0,0 % 0,0 % (Missing) 3,0 % 0,0 % 0,0 %
code: library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(palmerpenguins) #>  #> Attaching package: 'palmerpenguins' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:datasets': #>  #>     penguins, penguins_raw  penguins |> select(species, sex, island) |> ftable() #>                  island Biscoe Dream Torgersen #> species   sex                                  #> Adelie    female            22    27        24 #>           male              22    28        23 #> Chinstrap female             0    34         0 #>           male               0    34         0 #> Gentoo    female            58     0         0 #>           male              61     0         0 library(ivo.table)  penguins |> select(species, sex, island) |> ivo_table() penguins |>   select(species, sex, island) |>   ivo_table() |>    flextable::save_as_docx(path = "example_table.docx") penguins |>   select(species, sex, island) |>   ivo_table(colsums = TRUE,             rowsums = TRUE) penguins |>   select(species, sex, island) |>   ivo_table(percent_by = "col")

what: Changing the appearance of your tables
title: Quick and pretty frequency tables with ivo_table
text: ivo_table lots options customising look table. can change colours fonts used, highlight columns, rows cells, make columns bold, . Let’s look examples. Change font Courier, use red instead green, make names sex column bold:  species sex island Biscoe Dream Torgersen Adelie female 22 27 24 male 22 28 23 (Missing) 0 1 5 Chinstrap female 0 34 0 male 0 34 0 (Missing) 0 0 0 Gentoo female 58 0 0 male 61 0 0 (Missing) 5 0 0 Add caption highlight cell fourth row third column: table penguins  species sex island Biscoe Dream Torgersen Adelie female 22 27 24 male 22 28 23 (Missing) 0 1 5 Chinstrap female 0 34 0 male 0 34 0 (Missing) 0 0 0 Gentoo female 58 0 0 male 61 0 0 (Missing) 5 0 0 ivo_table returns flextable object, meaning functions used style flextables can used. instance, can change font size used different parts table using flextable::fontsize change background colour using flextable::bg:  species sex island Biscoe Dream Torgersen Adelie female 22 27 24 male 22 28 23 (Missing) 0 1 5 Chinstrap female 0 34 0 male 0 34 0 (Missing) 0 0 0 Gentoo female 58 0 0 male 61 0 0 (Missing) 5 0 0
code: penguins |>   select(species, sex, island) |>   ivo_table(color = "red",             font_name = "Courier",             bold_cols = 1) penguins |>   select(species, sex, island) |>   ivo_table(caption = "A table with penguins in it",             highlight_cols = 3,             highlight_rows = 4) penguins |>   select(species, sex, island) |>   ivo_table(color = "darkblue") |>    flextable::fontsize(size = 8, part = "body") |>    flextable::fontsize(size = 12, part = "header") |>    flextable::bg(bg = "pink", part = "all")

title: Quick and pretty frequency tables with ivo_table_gt
text: R great packages creating nice-looking tables. Packages like gt flextable allow user create wide range tables, lots flexibility presented formatted. downside Swiss army knife-style packages simple tasks, like creating frequency table, require lot typing. Enter ivo.table, package creating great-looking frequency tables contingency tables without hassle. package offers two functions creating tables: ivo_table, uses flextable framework, ivo_table_gt uses gt framework. vignette contains examples using latter.

title: Quick and pretty frequency tables with ivo_table_gt
text: Let’s look examples using penguins data palmerpenguins package. Say want create contingency table showing counts categorical variables species, sex, island. can use ftable along dplyr’s select: informative, formatting isn’t great, ’s something can easily export report presentation. ivo.table uses syntax, ivo_table_gt instead ftable: can add row column sums:
code: library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(palmerpenguins) #>  #> Attaching package: 'palmerpenguins' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:datasets': #>  #>     penguins, penguins_raw  penguins |> select(species, sex, island) |> ftable() #>                  island Biscoe Dream Torgersen #> species   sex                                  #> Adelie    female            22    27        24 #>           male              22    28        23 #> Chinstrap female             0    34         0 #>           male               0    34         0 #> Gentoo    female            58     0         0 #>           male              61     0         0 library(ivo.table)  penguins |> select(species, sex, island) |> ivo_table_gt() penguins |>   select(species, sex, island) |>   ivo_table_gt(sums = c("cols", "rows"))

what: Changing the appearance of your tables
title: Quick and pretty frequency tables with ivo_table_gt
text: can customise look ivo_table_gt table using styling arguments gt functions. can change colours fonts used, highlight columns, rows cells, make columns bold, . Let’s look examples. Change font Courier, use red instead green, make names sex column bold: Add caption highlight cell fourth row third column: ivo_table_gt returns gt object, meaning functions used style gt tables can used. can also paste ggplot2 plots tables together using patchwork:
code: library(gt) penguins |>   select(species, sex, island) |>   ivo_table_gt(color = "red",                font_name = "Courier") |>    tab_style(style = list(cell_text(weight = "bold")),                 locations = cells_stub()) penguins |>   select(species, sex, island) |>   ivo_table_gt(caption = "A table with penguins in it") |>      tab_style(style = list(cell_fill(color = "darkgreen")),                 locations = cells_body(columns = 5, rows = 4)) library(ggplot2) library(patchwork)  penguins_plot <- ggplot(penguins, aes(body_mass_g, fill = species)) +                     geom_density(alpha = 0.7) +                     theme(legend.position = "bottom")  penguins_table <- penguins |>                     select(species, sex, island) |>                     ivo_table_gt()  penguins_plot + penguins_table

what: Nicely Formatted Contingency Tables and Frequency Tables
title: Nicely Formatted Contingency Tables and Frequency Tables
text: R package provides functions easily creating nicely formatted frequency tables contingency tables (cross-tables), straightforward export HTML Office documents. can 1-way tables (wide long), 2-way tables, 3-way tables 4-way tables. based flextable. package developed IVO, Health Social Care Inspectorate Sweden.

title: Nicely Formatted Contingency Tables and Frequency Tables
text: install package CRAN: install development version Github:
code: install.packages("ivo.table") library(devtools) install_github("mthulin/ivo.table")

title: Nicely Formatted Contingency Tables and Frequency Tables
text: package used quickly create pretty frequency tables contingency tables/cross-tables. main function ivo_table. addition, also possible create masked tables, cells low counts censored, using ivo_table_masked. , give examples create format tables. First, generate example data.
code: # Generate data: example_data <- data.frame(Year = sample(2020:2023, 50, replace = TRUE), A = sample(c("Type 1", "Type 2"), 50, replace = TRUE), B = sample(c("Apples", "Oranges", "Bananas"), 50, replace = TRUE), C = sample(c("Swedish", "Norwegian", "Chilean"), 50, replace = TRUE))

title: Nicely Formatted Contingency Tables and Frequency Tables
code: data1 <- example_data |> dplyr::select(Year)  ivo_table(data1) ivo_table(data1, extra_header = FALSE) # Remove the header ivo_table(data1, color = "orange") # Change color on table lines ivo_table(data1, long_table = TRUE) # Draw the table in a long format ivo_table(data1, font_name = "Garamond") # Use a different font  ivo_table_masked(data1) # No masking because all counts are >=5 ivo_table_masked(data1, cell = 15) # Counts below <=15 are masked  # With pipes example_data |> dplyr::select(Year) |> ivo_table()

title: Nicely Formatted Contingency Tables and Frequency Tables
code: data2 <- example_data |> dplyr::select(A, B) data2_swap <- example_data |> dplyr::select(B, A)  # Basic tables: ivo_table(data2) ivo_table(data2_swap) # Swap order of the columns ivo_table(data2, colsums = TRUE) # Add the sum of each column ivo_table(data2, rowsums = TRUE) # Add the sum of each row ivo_table(data2, caption = "Awesome table") # Add a caption ivo_table(data2, highlight_cols = 3) # Highlight column 3 ivo_table(data2, highlight_rows = 2, highlight_cols = 3) # Highlight cell at row 2 column 3  # Tables with percentages: ivo_table(data2, percent_by = "row") # By row ivo_table(data2, percent_by = "col") # By column ivo_table(data2, percent_by = "tot") # By total  # Masked tables: ivo_table_masked(data2) ivo_table_masked(data2, cell = 7) # Counts <= 7 are masked # Row and column sums are also masked: ivo_table_masked( data2, cell = 3, colsums = TRUE, rowsums = TRUE)  # Add a note at the end of the table: # (colwidths must be set to the number of columns in the table) ivo_table(data2) |>   flextable::add_footer_row(values = "This is a footnote.",                             colwidths = 4)  # Add footnotes to cells in the table: ivo_table(data2) |> flextable::footnote(i = c(1, 3), j = c(1, 2),                     value = flextable::as_paragraph(c(                       "Some remark.",                       "Some comment.")),                     ref_symbols = c("a", "b"))  # Add footnotes to cells in the table header: ivo_table(data2) |> flextable::footnote(i = 2, j = c(1, 3),                     value = flextable::as_paragraph(c(                       "Some remark.",                       "Some comment.)),                     ref_symbols = c("a", "b"),                     part = "header")

title: Nicely Formatted Contingency Tables and Frequency Tables
code: data3 <- example_data |> dplyr::select(C, B, Year)  ivo_table(data3) ivo_table(data3, colsums = TRUE, rowsums = TRUE) # Add the sum of each column and each row  ivo_table_masked( data3, cell = 3, caption = "Values between 1 and 3 are masked." )

title: Nicely Formatted Contingency Tables and Frequency Tables
code: data4 <- example_data |> dplyr::select(Year, B, C, A)  ivo_table(data4) ivo_table(data4, remove_zero_rows = TRUE) # Remove the row with zeros  # Add the sum of each column and each row and highlight column 6: ivo_table( data4, colsums = TRUE, rowsums = TRUE, highlight_cols = 6)  ivo_table_masked(data4, colsums = TRUE, rowsums = TRUE)

what: Exporting to a Word docx file
title: Nicely Formatted Contingency Tables and Frequency Tables
text: export table docx file, use save_as_docx flextable follows:
code: ivo_table_masked(data4, colsums = TRUE, rowsums = TRUE) |> flextable::save_as_docx(path = "example_table.docx")

title: Use nice fonts and colors for tables — ivo_flextable_theme
text: x flextable. kway number "horizontal" variables table. rowsums logical, saying whether rightmost column table contains sum row. Defaults FALSE. caption optional string containing table caption. highlight_cols numeric vector containing indices columns highlighted. highlight_rows numeric vector containing indices rows highlighted. color named color color HEX code, used lines table. Defaults "darkgreen". font_name name font used table. Defaults "Arial". bold_cols numeric vector containing indices columns use bold font.

title: Create pretty frequency/contingency tables — ivo_table
text: ivo_table() lets easily create table using pretty fonts colors. want table masked values use ivo_table_masked().

title: Create pretty frequency/contingency tables — ivo_table
code: ivo_table(   df,   extra_header = TRUE,   exclude_missing = FALSE,   missing_string = "(Missing)",   colsums = FALSE,   rowsums = FALSE,   sums_string = "Total",   caption = NA,   highlight_cols = NULL,   highlight_rows = NULL,   percent_by = NA,   color = "darkgreen",   font_name = "Arial",   bold_cols = NULL,   long_table = FALSE,   remove_zero_rows = FALSE )

title: Create pretty frequency/contingency tables — ivo_table
text: df data frame 1-4 columns extra_header variable name displayed? Defaults TRUE. exclude_missing Whether exclude missing values table. Defaults FALSE. missing_string string used indicate missing values. Defaults "(Missing)". colsums logical indicating whether sum column computed. Defaults FALSE. rowsums logical indicating whether sum row computed. Defaults FALSE. sums_string string printed column/row row/column sums shown. Defaults "Total". caption optional string containing table caption. highlight_cols numeric vector containing indices columns highlighted. highlight_rows numeric vector containing indices rows highlighted. percent_by Used get percentages instead frequencies. three options: "row" get percentages row (row sum 100 percent), "col" get percentages column (sum row 100 percent) "tot" get percentages total (sum cells 100 percent). default, NA, means frequencies displayed instead. color named color color HEX code, used lines table. Defaults "darkgreen". font_name name font used table. Defaults "Arial". bold_cols numeric vector containing indices columns use bold font. long_table one-way tables: FALSE (default) means table wide consist single row, TRUE means table long consist single column. remove_zero_rows set TRUE, removes rows contain nothing zeros. default FALSE.

title: Create pretty frequency/contingency tables — ivo_table
text: stylized flextable.

title: Create pretty frequency/contingency tables — ivo_table
text: functions ivo_table() ivo_table_masked() takes data.frame 1-4 columns. order columns data.frame determine displayed table. first column always displayed top table. one column following 2-4 columns displayed left order 2, 3, 4. change columns displayed table; change place columns data.frame using dplyr::select().

title: Create pretty frequency/contingency tables — ivo_table

what: Add masking (censoring) to a table — ivo_table_add_mask
title: Add masking (censoring) to a table — ivo_table_add_mask
text: Table masking using cell counts.

title: Add masking (censoring) to a table — ivo_table_add_mask
code: ivo_table_add_mask(df, cell = 5)

title: Add masking (censoring) to a table — ivo_table_add_mask
text: df data frame containing column called "Freq", e.g. frequency table created using ftable(exclude=NULL) |> data.frame(). cell cell count masking used. Cell counts 1 number masked. default 5.

title: Add masking (censoring) to a table — ivo_table_add_mask
text: data frame masked cell counts.

title: Add masking (censoring) to a table — ivo_table_add_mask
text: Masking used prevent distribution tables individuals identified.

title: Add masking (censoring) to a table — ivo_table_add_mask
text: Måns Thulin

title: Add masking (censoring) to a table — ivo_table_add_mask
code: library(dplyr) example_data <- data.frame(Year = sample(2020:2023, 50, replace = TRUE), A = sample(c("Type 1", "Type 2"), 50, replace = TRUE), B = sample(c("Apples", "Oranges", "Bananas"), 50, replace = TRUE), C = sample(c("Swedish", "Norwegian", "Chilean"), 50, replace = TRUE)) # With masking limit set at 7: example_data |> select(Year, A) |>   ftable(exclude=NULL) |>   data.frame() |>   ivo_table_add_mask(cell = 7) #>   Year      A Freq #> 1 2020 Type 1    8 #> 2 2021 Type 1  1-7 #> 3 2022 Type 1  1-7 #> 4 2023 Type 1  1-7 #> 5 2020 Type 2  1-7 #> 6 2021 Type 2  1-7 #> 7 2022 Type 2  1-7 #> 8 2023 Type 2  1-7

what: Create pretty frequency/contingency GT tables — ivo_table_gt
title: Create pretty frequency/contingency GT tables — ivo_table_gt
text: ivo_table_gt() lets easily create GT table using pretty fonts colors.

title: Create pretty frequency/contingency GT tables — ivo_table_gt
code: ivo_table_gt(   df,   color = "darkgreen",   font_name = "Arial",   caption = NULL,   subtitle = NULL,   extra_header = TRUE,   source_note = NULL,   mask = NULL,   missing_string = "(Missing)",   sums = NULL )

title: Create pretty frequency/contingency GT tables — ivo_table_gt
text: df data frame 1-3 columns color named color color HEX code, used lines table. Defaults "darkgreen". font_name name font used table. Defaults "Arial". caption optional string containing table title. subtitle optional string containing table subtitle. usable together title. extra_header variable name displayed? Defaults TRUE. source_note optional string table source note. mask optional integer mask counts given value. missing_string string used indicate missing values. Defaults "(Missing)". sums optional vector add sums "rows" "cols".

title: Create pretty frequency/contingency GT tables — ivo_table_gt
text: stylized GT table.

title: Create pretty frequency/contingency GT tables — ivo_table_gt
text: functions ivo_table_gt() takes data.frame 1-3 columns. order columns data.frame determine displayed table. first column always displayed top table. one column following 2-3 columns displayed left order. change columns displayed table; change place columns data.frame using dplyr::select().

title: Create pretty frequency/contingency GT tables — ivo_table_gt
text: Stefan Furne

title: Create pretty frequency/contingency GT tables — ivo_table_gt
code: # Generate example data example_data <- data.frame(     Year = sample(2020:2023, 50, replace = TRUE),     A = sample(c("Type 1", "Type 2"), 50, replace = TRUE),     B = sample(c("Apples", "Oranges", "Bananas"), 50, replace = TRUE),     C = sample(c("Swedish", "Norwegian", "Chilean"), 50, replace = TRUE) )  ### 1 way tables ### data1 <- example_data |> dplyr::select(Year)  ivo_table_gt(data1)     Year       Count     2020 172021 112022 142023 8ivo_table_gt(data1, extra_header = FALSE) # Remove the header     Year       Count     2020 172021 112022 142023 8ivo_table_gt(data1, color = "orange") # Change color on table lines     Year       Count     2020 172021 112022 142023 8 ivo_table_gt(data1, mask = 15) # Counts below <=15 are masked     Year       Count     2020 172021 1 - 152022 1 - 152023 1 - 15 # With pipes example_data |>     dplyr::select(Year) |>     ivo_table_gt()     Year       Count     2020 172021 112022 142023 8 ### 2-way tables ### data2 <- example_data |> dplyr::select(A, B) data2_swap <- example_data |> dplyr::select(B, A)  # Basic tables: ivo_table_gt(data2)     B                A            Type 1       Type 2     Apples 7 9Bananas 9 6Oranges 10 9ivo_table_gt(data2_swap) # Swap order of the columns     A                B            Apples       Bananas       Oranges     Type 1 7 9 10Type 2 9 6 9ivo_table_gt(data2, sums = "cols") # Add the sum of each column     B                A            Type 1       Type 2     Apples 7 9Bananas 9 6Oranges 10 9Total 26 24ivo_table_gt(data2, sums = "rows") # Add the sum of each row     B                A              Total     Type 1       Type 2     Apples 7 9 16Bananas 9 6 15Oranges 10 9 19ivo_table_gt(data2, sums = c("cols", "rows")) # Add the sum of each row and column     B                A              Total     Type 1       Type 2     Apples 7 9 16Bananas 9 6 15Oranges 10 9 19Total 26 24 50ivo_table_gt(data2, caption = "Awesome table") # Add a caption     Awesome table     B                A            Type 1       Type 2     Apples 7 9Bananas 9 6Oranges 10 9ivo_table_gt(data2,     caption = "Awesome table",     subtitle = "It's really awesome" ) # Add a subtitle for the title     Awesome table     It's really awesome     B                A            Type 1       Type 2     Apples 7 9Bananas 9 6Oranges 10 9 # Masked tables: ivo_table_gt(data2, mask = 7) # Counts <= 7 are masked     B                A            Type 1       Type 2     Apples 1 - 7 9Bananas 9 1 - 7Oranges 10 9# Row and column sums are also masked: ivo_table_gt(     data2,     mask = 3,     sums = c("cols", "rows"), )     B                A              Total     Type 1       Type 2     Apples 7 9 16Bananas 9 6 15Oranges 10 9 19Total 26 24 50 # Add a note at the end of the table: # (colwidths must be set to the number of columns in the table) ivo_table_gt(data2, source_note = "This is a footnote.")     B                A            Type 1       Type 2     Apples 7 9Bananas 9 6Oranges 10 9This is a footnote.      ### 3-way tables ### data3 <- example_data |> dplyr::select(C, B, Year)  ivo_table_gt(data3)                     C            Chilean       Norwegian       Swedish     Apples     2020 1 0 42021 1 2 12022 1 2 12023 1 2 0Bananas     2020 2 5 22021 1 0 12022 0 3 02023 1 0 0Oranges     2020 1 1 12021 4 1 02022 3 3 12023 2 1 1ivo_table_gt(data3, sums = c("cols", "rows")) # Add the sum of each column and each row                     C              Total     Chilean       Norwegian       Swedish     Apples     2020 1 0 4 52021 1 2 1 42022 1 2 1 42023 1 2 0 3Total 4 6 6 16Bananas     2020 2 5 2 92021 1 0 1 22022 0 3 0 32023 1 0 0 1Total 4 8 3 15Oranges     2020 1 1 1 32021 4 1 0 52022 3 3 1 72023 2 1 1 4Total 10 6 3 19 ivo_table_gt(     data3,     mask = 3,     caption = "Values between 1 and 3 are masked." )     Values between 1 and 3 are masked.                     C            Chilean       Norwegian       Swedish     Apples     2020 1 - 3 0 42021 1 - 3 1 - 3 1 - 32022 1 - 3 1 - 3 1 - 32023 1 - 3 1 - 3 0Bananas     2020 1 - 3 5 1 - 32021 1 - 3 0 1 - 32022 0 1 - 3 02023 1 - 3 0 0Oranges     2020 1 - 3 1 - 3 1 - 32021 4 1 - 3 02022 1 - 3 1 - 3 1 - 32023 1 - 3 1 - 3 1 - 3

what: Create a masked frequency/contingency table — ivo_table_masked
title: Create a masked frequency/contingency table — ivo_table_masked
text: ivo_table_masked() lets easily create pretty masked tables. want table without masked values use ivo_table() instead.

title: Create a masked frequency/contingency table — ivo_table_masked
code: ivo_table_masked(   df,   cell = 5,   extra_header = TRUE,   exclude_missing = FALSE,   missing_string = "(Missing)",   colsums = FALSE,   rowsums = FALSE,   sums_string = "Total",   caption = NA,   highlight_cols = NULL,   highlight_rows = NULL,   color = "darkgreen",   font_name = "Arial",   bold_cols = NULL,   long_table = FALSE,   remove_zero_rows = FALSE )

title: Create a masked frequency/contingency table — ivo_table_masked
text: df data frame 1-4 columns cell largest value masked. Defaults 5, meaning values 1 5 masked. extra_header variable name displayed? Defaults TRUE. exclude_missing Whether exclude missing values table. Defaults FALSE. missing_string string used indicate missing values. Defaults "(Missing)". colsums logical indicating whether sum column computed. Defaults FALSE. rowsums logical indicating whether sum row computed. Defaults FALSE. sums_string string printed column/row row/column sums shown. Defaults "Total". caption optional string containing table caption. highlight_cols numeric vector containing indices columns highlighted. highlight_rows numeric vector containing indices rows highlighted. color named color color HEX code, used lines table. Defaults "darkgreen". font_name name font used table. Defaults "Arial". bold_cols numeric vector containing indices columns use bold font. long_table one-way tables: FALSE (default) means table wide consist single row, TRUE means table long consist single column. remove_zero_rows set TRUE, removes rows contain nothing zeros. default FALSE.

title: Create a masked frequency/contingency table — ivo_table_masked
text: stylized flextable.

title: Create a masked frequency/contingency table — ivo_table_masked
text: functions ivo_table() ivo_table_masked() takes data.frame 1-4 columns. order columns data.frame determine displayed table. first column always displayed top table. one column following 2-4 columns displayed left order 2, 3, 4. change columns displayed table; change place columns data.frame using dplyr::select().

title: Create a masked frequency/contingency table — ivo_table_masked

title: ivo.table version 0.7
text: Added function creating gt tables. Fixed bug caused errors ivo_table() used numeric variables missing data tibbles. Fixed bug occured three-way tables variable names contained spaces.

title: ivo.table version 0.6
text: CRAN release: 2025-01-15 Added options table formatting. Added vignette.

title: ivo.table version 0.5
text: CRAN release: 2024-08-28 Improved table formatting fixed bug occur datasets missing data.

text: CRAN release: 2024-02-06 Removed option export Excel due upstream changes flextable package. Bug fixes.

title: ivo.table version 0.3
